A cop from the provinces moves to Paris to join the Anti-Crime Brigade of Montfermeil, discovering an underworld where the tensions between the different groups mark the rhythm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10199590/","name":"Les misérables","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTZkYTBkY2MtMzRmNS00NjM3LWFiMzItZmJjNzNhMjgyYzczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODk4OTc3MTY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4044784/","name":"Damien Bonnard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6281424/","name":"Alexis Manenti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8815470/","name":"Djebril Zonga"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1868177/","name":"Ladj Ly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0601921/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0126452/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0750954/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1868177/","name":"Ladj Ly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0311488/","name":"Giordano Gederlini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6281424/","name":"Alexis Manenti"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1390722841","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQwZjJiM2UtMjlmYS00Yzk4LWE4ZjgtYTkwMTMyNDYyMjcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQwZjJiM2UtMjlmYS00Yzk4LWE4ZjgtYTkwMTMyNDYyMjcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Stéphane joined the Anti-Crime Brigade of Montfermeil, in the 93. He meets his new teammates, Chris and Gwada, and discovers the tensions between the different groups of the district."},"datePublished":"2019-11-20","description":"A cop from the provinces moves to Paris to join the Anti-Crime Brigade of Montfermeil, discovering an underworld where the tensions between the different groups mark the rhythm.","keywords":"parisian suburb,french flag,train station,train,paris france","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10199590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"altereggo123"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Potentially Great Cop Film But Ultimately A Cliched Cop Out","reviewBody":"This is a vivid depiction of a terrible "bainlieu"--a ghetto located in a Paris suburb. It's filled with poor immigrants, random criminals, juvenile delinquents, aimless kids, and all sorts of riff raff whose behavior ranges from viciousness to general mischief. With ineffective or no parenting or schooling, it's just chaos. There are fundemenalist Muslim preachers (some former convicts) and local gang leaders trying to impose their version of order. Into this add three cops--one a macho idiot, one well-meaning but weak, and one who is genuinely decent. The film does a pretty good job of showing how an abusive cop behaves, and it also captures the unreasonableness of the mobs of lawless teenagers who make life impossible.\n\nWhere it ultimately fails is creating the implication that these things are somehow morally equivalent or that the corruption of a rogue cop is a significant part of the reason for this chaotic, dysfunctional ghetto. Bad cops may thrive in an environment like this, but ghettos are not created by police. A fair depiction would emphasize other problems, many in the home, and a few good and bad cops would be minor factors. But movie makers can't resist humanizing criminals and demonizing cops, and the result is a 50/50 mix that is basically nonsense. I found the film incomplete and, in essence, an empty platitude."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21276,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

man","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0452625/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"troyuselius"},"dateCreated":"2007-09-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the Worst "Comedies" Ever!","reviewBody":"First off, Dane Cook sucks. I only went to see this movie because I had a free preview ticket. It was even worse than I was expecting (and I was expecting pretty bad, seeing as Dane Cook is in it). There is only one more laugh in this movie than I've ever gotten from Dane Cook (namely, one laugh, and it had nothing to do with Dane Cook's "performance").

Well, at least Dane Cook didn't steal any jokes in this movie, at least none that I noticed. Dan Fogler also delivered an extremely annoying character in the movie. A character that piggish should have been funny, but he somehow didn't get a single laugh from me, or the entire viewing audience.

(One unrelated note here, I was confused how we watched the entire movie and there was only one laugh, everyone was obviously bored, no less than five people walked out and still when it ended a few morons clapped?!?! Anyway back to the trashing this movie deserves...) This movie is being bashed by critics and it deserves it 110%. The plot is based on a ridiculous premise. I didn't notice the written by credits but it was so stupid and ill-contrived I'm assuming Dane Cook must have had a hand in it. On top of that, it's misogynistic (again talking about the Fogler character in particular) to an incredible degree but still can't get a single laugh out of it.

Do yourself a favor, see any movie other than this! Even if it's not a comedy, it will still be more funny. And even if it's a grade two student film made by a mentally challenged kid with A.D.D. it will have a more believable and heartfelt plot.

Looks like this movie has already bombed, which is great because it hopefully gets us one step closer to a Dane-free world. What an awful movie!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86602,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: L'incroyable histoire du facteur Cheval
Pałac idealny
programme.desc: Directed by Nils Tavernier. With Jacques Gamblin, Laetitia Casta, Florence Thomassin, Bernard Le Coq. Cheval is a postman who travels every day along the Drôme. He meets the woman of his life, Philomena and from their union Alice was born. He then throws himself into a crazy gamble: to build her with his own hands, an incredible palace.

programme.title: Bolt
Piorun
programme.desc:
Bolt: Directed by Byron Howard, Chris Williams. With John Travolta, Miley Cyrus, Susie Essman, Mark Walton. The canine star of a fictional sci-fi/action show that believes his powers are real embarks on a cross country trek to save his co-star from a threat he believes is just as real." data-id="main"/><script is the first theatrical trailer for Bolt, directed by Byron Howard and Chris Williams."},"datePublished":"2008-12-17","description":"The canine star of a fictional sci-fi/action show that believes his powers are real embarks on a cross country trek to save his co-star from a threat he believes is just as real.","keywords":"dog,cat,hamster,reference to tiger beat magazine,time bomb","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0397892/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Apemangalore"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Easily my favorite Disney film, and perhaps my absolute favorite movie of all time","reviewBody":"The 2000s have not been very kind to Walt Disney Animation. While there has been the occasional Emperor's New Groove or Lilo and Stitch, the majority of their films from this decade have been rather mediocre (most notably 2005's Chicken Little, which - ironically - remains the studio's highest-grossing film of the 2000s). With that said, I initially had some doubts about Bolt, despite hearing that it would be Disney Animation's first film supervised by Pixar founder John Lasseter. The surprisingly positive reviews posted shortly before the film's release convinced me to buy a ticket. Thankfully, I was forced to eat my words; welcome back, Disney.

The film revolves around Bolt, a white German Shephered who has spent his entire life on the set of a TV show in which he portrays a "superdog". As a result, he believes that the events on film (and his super powers) are real. When he is accidentally shipped from his Hollywood soundstage to New York City, he embarks on a cross-country journey to reunite with his owner and co-star, Penny. Along the way, Bolt teams up with a jaded alley cat named Mittens and a TV-obsessed hamster named Rhino who also happens to be an extreme Bolt fanboy.

First of all, the effects in this movie are unbelievable. Everything in the movie looks so realistic and yet doesn't contradict with the animated cartoon-esquire characters. Also, while Bolt is obviously the star of the movie, the real comedy comes from his unlikely companions. In fact, my favorite character of the bunch is Mittens the cat, voiced excellently by Susie Essman. Very seldom do I hear/see a character and say "I can't imagine anybody doing a better job playing him/her", but Essman really brings a lot to this already memorable character. And though I found him to be pretty irritating at first, some of the best lines in the movie come from Rhino the hamster.

Lastly, in one of the opening scenes we see Bolt as he is in the TV Show to set the understanding of Bolt's world. Seriously, that was made of awesome. The scene was action packed and full of excitement. I would watch the show that Bolt is in. If I had to have a complaint, it would be that it takes some ideas from several other films (such as Homeward Bound, Toy Story, and The Truman Show). That said, it still manages to feel like its own film, and with grace.

With terrific animation, an incredibly heartwarming story, and some of the most endearing characters I've ever seen on film (animated or otherwise), Bolt has not only become my favorite Disney film (Pixar included), but perhaps my absolute favorite movie of all time. It feels strange saying that, especially considering that I didn't even expect to like the film, but I simply can't think of a movie that I've loved more. It's also one of the very few films that manages to bring me to tears every time that I watch it, and when a movie is able to affect me on that kind of level, it automatically becomes a winner.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":194576,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

bomb","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0397892/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Apemangalore","dateCreated":"2009-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Easily my favorite Disney film, and perhaps my absolute favorite movie of all time","reviewBody":"The 2000s have not been very kind to Walt Disney Animation. While there has been the occasional Emperor's New Groove or Lilo and Stitch, the majority of their films from this decade have been rather mediocre (most notably 2005's Chicken Little, which - ironically - remains the studio's highest-grossing film of the 2000s). With that said, I initially had some doubts about Bolt, despite hearing that it would be Disney Animation's first film supervised by Pixar founder John Lasseter. The surprisingly positive reviews posted shortly before the film's release convinced me to buy a ticket. Thankfully, I was forced to eat my words; welcome back, Disney.

The film revolves around Bolt, a white German Shephered who has spent his entire life on the set of a TV show in which he portrays a "superdog". As a result, he believes that the events on film (and his super powers) are real. When he is accidentally shipped from his Hollywood soundstage to New York City, he embarks on a cross-country journey to reunite with his owner and co-star, Penny. Along the way, Bolt teams up with a jaded alley cat named Mittens and a TV-obsessed hamster named Rhino who also happens to be an extreme Bolt fanboy.

First of all, the effects in this movie are unbelievable. Everything in the movie looks so realistic and yet doesn't contradict with the animated cartoon-esquire characters. Also, while Bolt is obviously the star of the movie, the real comedy comes from his unlikely companions. In fact, my favorite character of the bunch is Mittens the cat, voiced excellently by Susie Essman. Very seldom do I hear/see a character and say "I can't imagine anybody doing a better job playing him/her", but Essman really brings a lot to this already memorable character. And though I found him to be pretty irritating at first, some of the best lines in the movie come from Rhino the hamster.

Lastly, in one of the opening scenes we see Bolt as he is in the TV Show to set the understanding of Bolt's world. Seriously, that was made of awesome. The scene was action packed and full of excitement. I would watch the show that Bolt is in. If I had to have a complaint, it would be that it takes some ideas from several other films (such as Homeward Bound, Toy Story, and The Truman Show). That said, it still manages to feel like its own film, and with grace.

With terrific animation, an incredibly heartwarming story, and some of the most endearing characters I've ever seen on film (animated or otherwise), Bolt has not only become my favorite Disney film (Pixar included), but perhaps my absolute favorite movie of all time. It feels strange saying that, especially considering that I didn't even expect to like the film, but I simply can't think of a movie that I've loved more. It's also one of the very few films that manages to bring me to tears every time that I watch it, and when a movie is able to affect me on that kind of level, it automatically becomes a winner.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":194576,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect Sarah Connor and safeguard the future, an unexpected turn of events creates a fractured timeline. Now, Sgt. Reese finds himself in a new and unfamiliar version of the past, where he is faced with unlikely allies, including the Guardian, dangerous new enemies, and an unexpected new mission: To reset the future..."},"datePublished":"2015-07-08","description":"When John Connor, leader of the human resistance, sends Sgt. Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect Sarah Connor and safeguard the future, an unexpected turn of events creates a fractured timeline.","keywords":"cyborg,future,time machine,human versus cyborg,human versus robot","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1340138/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chriskylie"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Serviceable action flick suffering from the shadow of its franchise","reviewBody":"If it wasn't part of such a genre redefining franchise as Terminator, Genisys would be a perfectly serviceable action sci-fi. Sure the dialogue is clunky as hell, the convoluted time travel conceits don't ever really make sense and despite one decent twist it's a tad predictable. But hey this is blockbuster cinema and the action is great, the film rattles along at pace and the acting is genuinely not bad (Courtenay spending a large part of the film topless didn't hurt either!). But you can't escape the legacy. This IS supposed to be part of the Terminator mythology. Despite Arnie's best comedic efforts (he steals most scenes he's in) you can't get past what an inferior addition this is to join at least two of the most iconic sci-fi films of the 20th century. Whilst enjoyable enough in its own right, hopefully this will be the last attempt to resurrect the past Terminator glories.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":263479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

A boy in New York is taken in by a wealthy family after his mother is killed in a bombing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. In a rush of panic, he steals 'The Goldfinch', a painting that eventually draws him into a world of crime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3864056/","name":"The Goldfinch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZmNmUzNTctYTA3Mi00ZTg3LWFmMWMtYzU2ZjA3NDRmODIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4625502/","name":"Oakes Fegley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5052065/","name":"Ansel Elgort"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000173/","name":"Nicole Kidman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1259871/","name":"John Crowley"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212151/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1661186/","name":"Peter Straughan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1535570/","name":"Donna Tartt"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1449638937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJlMTEyOTMtOWM4ZS00NjdhLWIxZTktMDI1N2U5OWMwYzQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJlMTEyOTMtOWM4ZS00NjdhLWIxZTktMDI1N2U5OWMwYzQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy in New York is taken in by a wealthy Upper East Side family after his mother is killed in a bombing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art."},"datePublished":"2019-09-13","description":"A boy in New York is taken in by a wealthy family after his mother is killed in a bombing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. In a rush of panic, he steals 'The Goldfinch', a painting that eventually draws him into a world of crime.","keywords":"pulitzer prize source,head wound,eating,shootout,telephone book","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3864056/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"karimgh"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The critics are wrong about this one","reviewBody":"I had high hopes for this movie ever since it was announced, as it had cast an all-star cast and the novel (though I never read it) was considered great, so when the negative reviews came out, I lowered my expectations going into the movie and I'm glad I did. The cinematography was great as well as the directing, Oakes Fegley is a star in the making and this is his movie. The remaining cast was pretty good and Finn Wolfhard, despite what critics are saying, nails the Russian accent. This movie represents life and how just one mistake can change your future drastically and it's not a movie for casual film-goers (as I thought 10 minutes could have been trimmed). In a rush of panic, he steals 'The Goldfinch', a painting that eventually draws him into a world of crime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3864056/","name":"The Goldfinch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZmNmUzNTctYTA3Mi00ZTg3LWFmMWMtYzU2ZjA3NDRmODIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4625502/","name":"Oakes Fegley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5052065/","name":"Ansel Elgort","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000173/","name":"Nicole Kidman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1259871/","name":"John Crowley"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212151/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1661186/","name":"Peter Straughan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1535570/","name":"Donna Tartt"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1449638937","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJlMTEyOTMtOWM4ZS00NjdhLWIxZTktMDI1N2U5OWMwYzQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJlMTEyOTMtOWM4ZS00NjdhLWIxZTktMDI1N2U5OWMwYzQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy in New York is taken in by a wealthy Upper East Side family after his mother is killed in a bombing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.","datePublished":"2019-09-13","description":"A boy in New York is taken in by a wealthy family after his mother is killed in a bombing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. In a rush of panic, he steals 'The Goldfinch', a painting that eventually draws him into a world of crime.","keywords":"pulitzer prize source,head wound,eating,shootout,telephone book","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3864056/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"karimgh","dateCreated":"2019-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The critics are wrong about this one","reviewBody":"I had high hopes for this movie ever since it was announced, as it had cast an all-star cast and the novel (though I never read it) was considered great, so when the negative reviews came out, I lowered my expectations going into the movie and I'm glad I did. The cinematography was great as well as the directing, Oakes Fegley is a star in the making and this is his movie. The remaining cast was pretty good and Finn Wolfhard, despite what critics are saying, nails the Russian accent. This movie represents life and how just one mistake can change your future drastically and it's not a movie for casual film-goers (as I thought 10 minutes could have been trimmed). All in all I loved The Goldfinch and don't let the critics convince you not to watch it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"duration":"PT2H29M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Terminator Genisys: Directed by Alan Taylor. With Arnold Schwarzenegger, Jason Clarke, Emilia Clarke, Jai Courtney. When John Connor, leader of the human resistance, sends Sgt. Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect Sarah Connor and safeguard the future, an unexpected turn of events creates a fractured timeline." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1340138/","name":"Terminator Genisys","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1NTc0NzE4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDkyNjQ1NTE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000216/","name":"Arnold Schwarzenegger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0164809/","name":"Jason Clarke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3592338/","name":"Emilia Clarke"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851930/","name":"Alan Taylor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152219/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323215/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0436164/","name":"Laeta Kalogridis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527261/","name":"Patrick Lussier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000116/","name":"James Cameron"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1249751321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MTg5OTExOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODM0OTEzNTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MTg5OTExOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODM0OTEzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When John Connor, leader of the human resistance, sends Sgt. Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect Sarah Connor and safeguard the future, an unexpected turn of events creates a fractured timeline. Now, Sgt. Reese finds himself in a new and unfamiliar version of the past, where he is faced with unlikely allies, including the Guardian, dangerous new enemies, and an unexpected new mission: To reset the future..."},"datePublished":"2015-07-08","description":"When John Connor, leader of the human resistance, sends Sgt. Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect Sarah Connor and safeguard the future, an unexpected turn of events creates a fractured timeline.","keywords":"cyborg,future,time machine,human versus cyborg,human versus robot","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1340138/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chriskylie"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Serviceable action flick suffering from the shadow of its franchise","reviewBody":"If it wasn't part of such a genre redefining franchise as Terminator, Genisys would be a perfectly serviceable action sci-fi. Sure the dialogue is clunky as hell, the convoluted time travel conceits don't ever really make sense and despite one decent twist it's a tad predictable. But hey this is blockbuster cinema and the action is great, the film rattles along at pace and the acting is genuinely not bad (Courtenay spending a large part of the film topless didn't hurt either!). But you can't escape the legacy. This IS supposed to be part of the Terminator mythology. Despite Arnie's best comedic efforts (he steals most scenes he's in) you can't get past what an inferior addition this is to join at least two of the most iconic sci-fi films of the 20th century. Whilst enjoyable enough in its own right, hopefully this will be the last attempt to resurrect the past Terminator glories.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":263479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

final fight against the reigning heavyweight champ Mason 'The Line' Dixon.","keywords":"retired boxer,tough guy,sweat,sequel to best picture winner,computer simulation","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479143/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rogerdarlington"},"dateCreated":"2007-01-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Packs a punch","reviewBody":"It all started way back in 1976 when Sylvester Stallone - who wrote the script and took the leading role - created the character of the Philadelphia low-grade boxer who managed, against all the odds, to go the distance with world heavyweight champion Aollo Creed and give the world a new kind of underdog to support. In "Rocky II" (1979), after 15 brutal rounds, he defeats Creed and takes the title. In 1982, "Rocky III" sees our hero lose to Mt T before Apollo helps him bounce back. By the time of "Rocky IV" (1985), the franchise had acquired an international dimension as the Cold War is acted out in the ring with Rocky squaring up to the Russian Ivan Drago. Another five years passed before Stallone felt that he had to return to the iconic role - in "Rocky V", he adopts a young fighter who turns on him.

That really should have been it - but, as the tagline for "Rocky Balboa" puts it, "It ain't over till it's over" so, 16 year after the last film and an amazing 30 years after the original movie, he's back. It seems that Rock is so missing his wife Adrian that, in spite of running a successful restaurant named after her, he finds that he has something "luking in the basement". On this sixth outing, the narrative arc is just the same as first time round - again a complete no-chancer facing a world champion after a gruelling training routine involving the same frozen meat, the same one-armed press-ups, and of course the same race up the Museum of Art steps - and the same music.

What's different is the advanced years of Rocky and of course Stallone himself - but he looks good, the film looks good, and you'll feel good at the final bell. As the man says: "It ain't about how hard you hit, it is about how hard you can get hit and keep moving forward, how much can you take and keep moving forward. That's how winning is done!""},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":207014,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

For The Skeleton Twins"},"datePublished":"2014-09-11","description":"Having both coincidentally cheated death on the same day, estranged twins reunite with the possibility of mending their relationship.","keywords":"brother sister relationship,siblings,suicide attempt,adultery,estrangement","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1571249/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tmpsvita"},"dateCreated":"2018-05-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fraternal love of two twins who face the disappointments of a difficult life","reviewBody":"A truly discreet dramatic comedy that with great depth and at the same time intimacy, digs into a particular relationship between two twins linked by the same childhood almost totally conditioned by a present and affectionate but at the same time very sad father who concluded early his life with a suicide that has greatly influenced the past but also the present of his two sons. Twins at the same time so different yet so similar and bound by a strong and extremely credible and deep brotherly love, similar also in the kind of life, an unsatisfactory, melancholy life where something is missing enough to bring both to attempt suicide just like their father had done before them to look for an escape from the disappointments and injustices of life. A relationship that has suffered from a distance that lasted more than ten years but perhaps it is the only thing that can complete their life and that can make them move forward together. One of the biggest surprises of the film is precisely the interpretations of the two protagonists, Kristen Wiig who proves to be unexpectedly talented even in dramatic roles and an extraordinary Bill Hader that represents the soul of the film thanks to its performance in perfect harmony with its charismatic and complexed character. What is missing from the film is a more incisive personality and a better beat and amalgamated rhythm that would have helped especially to make it more engaging and less heavy, in any case manages to convey a variety of emotions thanks to many scenes that I will hardly forget because of their really strong emotional impact.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40784,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: GoldenEye
GoldenEye
programme.desc:
GoldenEye: Directed by Martin Campbell. With Pierce Brosnan, Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco, Famke Janssen. Years after a friend and fellow 00 agent is killed on a joint mission, a secret space based weapons program known as "GoldenEye" is stolen. James Bond sets out to stop a Russian crime syndicate from using the weapon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113189/","name":"GoldenEye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk2OTg4MTk1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjExNTgzNA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000112/","name":"Pierce Brosnan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000293/","name":"Sean Bean"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001713/","name":"Izabella Scorupco"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0132709/","name":"Martin Campbell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0289833/","name":"Michael France"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0128997/","name":"Jeffrey Caine"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"GoldenEye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2674918169","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM3MmNmZGQtNzUxYi00N2Q5LTg0YmYtY2ZjMWUwMWFlMWI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM3MmNmZGQtNzUxYi00N2Q5LTg0YmYtY2ZjMWUwMWFlMWI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from MGM/UA"},"datePublished":"1995-11-17","description":"Years after a friend and fellow 00 agent is killed on a joint mission, a secret space based weapons program known as "GoldenEye" is stolen. James Bond sets out to stop a Russian crime syndicate from using the weapon.","keywords":"official james bond series,official bond film,british secret service,cossack,james bond character","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113189/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ivo-cobra8"},"dateCreated":"2017-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"GoldenEye is my number 1 favorite James Bond 007 action film of all time - the best one","reviewBody":"GoldenEye (1995) is my number 1 personal favorite movie of all time! James Bond 007 action film the best one that was ever made. In my opinion it is the best one I love this movie to death! I grew up watching it as a child and Pierce Brosnan is my number 1 favorite James Bond. GoldenEye is the first film to star Pierce Brosnan as the fictional MI6 officer James Bond. The film was directed by Martin Campbell and is the first in the series not to take story elements from the works of novelist Ian Fleming.

I'm a hard-core James Bond fan. I make no apologies for believing that Pierce Brosnan is the closest thing we've seen to IAN FLEMING's James Bond. The reason because it is my favorite it is because I feel it is just action, action , action and more action. I never feel bored with it, or it is too over long like some Bond movies are it is fast paced, entertaining and hard core action. The plot is simply and the story never get's bored. It is a beautiful movie, with beautiful direction from Martin Campbell. The stunts are completely insane in scale in this movie and really dangerous.

Music score is by Éric Serra, the title song is GoldenEye performed by Tina Turner. GoldenEye was released in 1995 after a six-year hiatus in the series caused by legal disputes, during which Timothy Dalton resigned from the role of James Bond and was replaced by Pierce Brosnan. M was also recast, with actress Judi Dench becoming the first woman to portray the character, replacing Robert Brown. The role of Miss Moneypenny was also recast, with Caroline Bliss being replaced by Samantha Bond: Desmond Llewelyn was the only actor to reprise his role, as Q. GoldenEye was the first Bond film made after the dissolution of the Soviet Union and the end of the Cold War, which provided a background for the plot.

Style and sophistication are in abundance - - "The name's Bond. James Bond." 

Goldeneye's female characters are honestly beautiful with particular techniques. GoldenEye was released in 1995 after a six-year hiatus in the series caused by legal disputes, during which Timothy Dalton resigned from the role of James Bond and was replaced by Pierce Brosnan. M was also recast, with actress Judi Dench becoming the first woman to portray the character, replacing Robert Brown. The role of Miss Moneypenny was also recast, with Caroline Bliss being replaced by Samantha Bond: Desmond Llewelyn was the only actor to reprise his role, as Q. GoldenEye was the first Bond film made after the dissolution of the Soviet Union and the end of the Cold War, which provided a background for the plot.

space","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406375/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"clydekennedy"},"dateCreated":"2019-01-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasant sci-fi can be enjoyed by everyone.","reviewBody":"Zathura took me by surprise. Its like Jumanji but set in space. Zathura will work better for younger viewers than older ones. There's not much plot to absorb and there's plenty of action, so this is the kind of spectacle that will appeal to those without long attention spans. For adults, there are moments of genuine suspense, and a nice twist or two (nothing too fancy). The action is standard-order science fiction stuff, but it's handled well by Favreau, so it never feels too derivative. The visuals are eye-popping - lots of pretty scenery and there's never an instance when the CGI comes across as cheap or silly. Unlike Jumanji, Zathura is a complete movie-going experience. And it's suitable for the entire family (although young children may be frightened by the Zorgons, who are scary-looking). The simplicity of the plot is a strength and weakness, but Favreau's sure-handed direction does a good job of obscuring how little meat exists on the bones of the story."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":96133,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5884052/","name":"Pokémon: Detective Pikachu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU4Mzc3NzE5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzE1NzI1NzM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005351/","name":"Ryan Reynolds"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6819854/","name":"Justice Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1105980/","name":"Kathryn Newton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1224299/","name":"Rob Letterman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0243099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2021624/","name":"Dan Hernandez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1658012/","name":"Benji Samit"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1224299/","name":"Rob Letterman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":""Destiny" Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3254238233","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTRkNjhmNDQtNTcyZC00YzMwLThkMGMtYmI3MTQ4MTQzNGJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTRkNjhmNDQtNTcyZC00YzMwLThkMGMtYmI3MTQ4MTQzNGJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective. Starring Ryan Reynolds as the voice of Pikachu."},"datePublished":"2019-05-03","description":"In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective.","keywords":"pokemon,cinematic universe,shared universe,based on video game,pikachu character","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5884052/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aobo33"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fun moments, but not a great film; substantially overhyped","reviewBody":"(Theater impressions--short review) Semi-casual Pokémon fan here--played through a few of the games (never played Detective Pikachu), watched the anime as a kid, but not super invested in the franchise. A lot of people seem to be giving this movie high ratings. Detective Pikachu is not without merit, but the film's good points (namely, Ryan Reynold's performance, some good humor, some nice character interaction and overall high production values) are unfortunately outweighed by its bad points (namely, a needlessly and hopelessly convoluted plot, hit-or-miss performances from the remaining cast, some jokes that didn't land, some heavy-handed dialogue and some poor character interaction, and lack-luster CGI). The film is overall inconsistent in tone; it doesn't seem to really know who it's for or what it wants to be. I had fun watching the film with my friends in the theater (who are also familiar with Pokémon), but if you're unfamiliar with Pokémon or if you're watching it on your own on the small screen it might not quite be an enjoyable experience.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":144933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Directed by David Fincher. With Jake Gyllenhaal, Robert Downey Jr., Mark Ruffalo, Anthony Edwards. In the late 1960s/early 1970s, a San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.

programme.title: Sorry We Missed You
Nie ma nas w domu
programme.desc: Sorry We Missed You: Directed by Ken Loach. With Kris Hitchen, Debbie Honeywood, Rhys Stone, Katie Proctor. Hoping that self-employment through gig economy can solve their financial woes, a hard-up UK delivery driver and his wife struggling to raise a family end up trapped in the vicious circle of this modern-day form of labour exploitation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8359816/","name":"Sorry We Missed You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhlYTYzM2MtMGM5ZC00MjRlLWI5NTYtMDNmZGE0ZTAyNWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI3NDAyNg@@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1106944/","name":"Kris Hitchen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10214834/","name":"Debbie Honeywood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10427036/","name":"Rhys Stone"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0516360/","name":"Ken Loach"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104621/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0178188/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0491956/","name":"Paul Laverty"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi404864025","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc3OGE1MTItNzA0NS00MGNiLWFmZGItMDc5ZWFlZjM5ZTAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc3OGE1MTItNzA0NS00MGNiLWFmZGItMDc5ZWFlZjM5ZTAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A delivery driver and his wife struggle to get by in modern-day England. Directed by Ken Loach."},"datePublished":"2019-10-23","description":"Hoping that self-employment through gig economy can solve their financial woes, a hard-up UK delivery driver and his wife struggling to raise a family end up trapped in the vicious circle of this modern-day form of labour exploitatio","keywords":"poverty,delivery driver,husband wife relationship,money problems,working class","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8359816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mhardingyoung"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Heartbreaking but needs to be told.","reviewBody":"Another critical analysis of life in England in 2019. Has English society changed at all since Ken Loach' first films in the 60s? It seems not. Heartbreaking, shameful, relatable and tragically so true. We can all relate to the characters,they are our friends and neighbours and think, there but for the grace of god...... The film reminded me of On the Waterfront, with the corrupt 1950s dockside gang masters. How can these working practices have been allowed in England, in the C21st? A decade of capitalist government lade bare, just as the UK decides it's future yet again. Other "reviews" suggest the acting is suspect in places, but I feel this is the film's and LoachKs skill in making the film appear to be so real , so natural, so tragically real. Every scene and every prop had meaning, from the dreadful state of the rented house - why aren't landlords forced to maintain a decent level of decoration and repair. To the fast food of the van dash board- so what is the social and health cost of forcing drivers to work long hours, with no breaks eating sugar filled snacks. To the school who excluded a young man for 2 weeks with no support or, understanding of the causes or support needed. A true essay of English life in 2019. Tragic.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18389,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

Directed by Ken Loach.","datePublished":"2019-10-23","description":"Hoping that self-employment through gig economy can solve their financial woes, a hard-up UK delivery driver and his wife struggling to raise a family end up trapped in the vicious circle of this modern-day form of labour exploitatio","keywords":"poverty,delivery driver,husband wife relationship,money problems,working class","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8359816/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mhardingyoung","dateCreated":"2019-11-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Heartbreaking but needs to be told.","reviewBody":"Another critical analysis of life in England in 2019. Has English society changed at all since Ken Loach' first films in the 60s? It seems not. Heartbreaking, shameful, relatable and tragically so true. We can all relate to the characters,they are our friends and neighbours and think, there but for the grace of god...... The film reminded me of On the Waterfront, with the corrupt 1950s dockside gang masters. How can these working practices have been allowed in England, in the C21st? A decade of capitalist government lade bare, just as the UK decides it's future yet again. Other "reviews" suggest the acting is suspect in places, but I feel this is the film's and LoachKs skill in making the film appear to be so real , so natural, so tragically real. Every scene and every prop had meaning, from the dreadful state of the rented house - why aren't landlords forced to maintain a decent level of decoration and repair. To the fast food of the van dash board- so what is the social and health cost of forcing drivers to work long hours, with no breaks eating sugar filled snacks. To the school who excluded a young man for 2 weeks with no support or, understanding of the causes or support needed. A true essay of English life in 2019. Tragic.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18389,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="

In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5884052/","name":"Pokémon: Detective Pikachu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU4Mzc3NzE5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzE1NzI1NzM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005351/","name":"Ryan Reynolds"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6819854/","name":"Justice Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1105980/","name":"Kathryn Newton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1224299/","name":"Rob Letterman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0243099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2021624/","name":"Dan Hernandez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1658012/","name":"Benji Samit"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1224299/","name":"Rob Letterman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":""Destiny" Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3254238233","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTRkNjhmNDQtNTcyZC00YzMwLThkMGMtYmI3MTQ4MTQzNGJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTRkNjhmNDQtNTcyZC00YzMwLThkMGMtYmI3MTQ4MTQzNGJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective. Starring Ryan Reynolds as the voice of Pikachu."},"datePublished":"2019-05-03","description":"In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective.","keywords":"pokemon,cinematic universe,shared universe,based on video game,pikachu character","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5884052/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aobo33"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fun moments, but not a great film; substantially overhyped","reviewBody":"(Theater impressions--short review) Semi-casual Pokémon fan here--played through a few of the games (never played Detective Pikachu), watched the anime as a kid, but not super invested in the franchise. A lot of people seem to be giving this movie high ratings. Detective Pikachu is not without merit, but the film's good points (namely, Ryan Reynold's performance, some good humor, some nice character interaction and overall high production values) are unfortunately outweighed by its bad points (namely, a needlessly and hopelessly convoluted plot, hit-or-miss performances from the remaining cast, some jokes that didn't land, some heavy-handed dialogue and some poor character interaction, and lack-luster CGI). The film is overall inconsistent in tone; it doesn't seem to really know who it's for or what it wants to be. I had fun watching the film with my friends in the theater (who are also familiar with Pokémon), but if you're unfamiliar with Pokémon or if you're watching it on your own on the small screen it might not quite be an enjoyable experience.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":144933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

A lot of people seem to be giving this movie high ratings. Detective Pikachu is not without merit, but the film's good points (namely, Ryan Reynold's performance, some good humor, some nice character interaction and overall high production values) are unfortunately outweighed by its bad points (namely, a needlessly and hopelessly convoluted plot, hit-or-miss performances from the remaining cast, some jokes that didn't land, some heavy-handed dialogue and some poor character interaction, and lack-luster CGI). A famous author goes on a cruise trip with her friends and nephew in an effort to find fun and happiness while she comes to terms with her troubled past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10808832/","name":"Let Them All Talk","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWIwMDFiZTMtMTc2NS00ZjkxLWJmNDgtOWFhZjVkNDNkZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2110418/","name":"Gemma Chan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001848/","name":"Dianne Wiest"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001752/","name":"Steven Soderbergh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0784743/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0265102/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0251977/","name":"Deborah Eisenberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3569664281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzAyNTI2NjYtODcyZC00YTE3LThmYzgtOTQ0MTQ1MTEwYjMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzAyNTI2NjYtODcyZC00YTE3LThmYzgtOTQ0MTQ1MTEwYjMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"'Let Them All Talk' tells the story of a celebrated author (Meryl Streep) who takes a journey with some old friends (Candice Bergen and Dianne Wiest) to have some fun and heal old wounds. Her nephew (Lucas Hedges) comes along to wrangle the ladies as well as her new literary agent (Gemma Chan) who is desperate to find out about her next book. "},"datePublished":"2020-12-10","description":"A famous author goes on a cruise trip with her friends and nephew in an effort to find fun and happiness while she comes to terms with her troubled past.","keywords":"author,nephew,literary agent,ocean liner,old friend","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10808832/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eoswaldbigred"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"What an enormous disappointment","reviewBody":"What an enormous disappointment.

I was very much anticipating this. Meryl Streep, Dianne Wiest, and Candice Bergen - what a cast!

What a bore. It felt like there was no script, that it was all ad-libbed and nobody knew what to say or how to bring any story.

ZERO character development. Almost NO conflict. Maybe five lines of conflict for the first 90 minutes. Then one scene sort of out of nowhere. It was strange.

The kid playing the nephew could hardly act. And apparently is incapable of washing nor brushing his hair.

The only thing I can figure is that they wanted to be directed by Steven Soderbergh. And with the music crescendo at the end, it made you feel like Soderbergh thought he just directed something deep. Instead it was almost two hours of... nothing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

The kids go head to head with an unstoppable enemy who has targeted Leslie -- or more accurately, the child she's carrying. Nico draws them all into a dark realm where its ruler Morgan le Fay is much more nefarious than anyone the kids have yet to face."},"datePublished":"2017-11-21","description":"After discovering their parents are super-villains in disguise, a group of teenagers band together to run away from their homes in order to atone for their parents' actions and to discover the secrets of their origins.","keywords":"shared universe,superheroine,teenager,super villain,marvel cinematic universe","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1236246/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eisenmyer1234"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"OK show. Thought it would be better","reviewBody":"The show is moving at a much slower pace than the trailer suggested which I wouldn't have minded had the show been any good. Runaways is decent at best with mundane script writing and an over saturation of clichéd characters. They've introduced so many characters early on that you're almost perplexed at times as to who's who and their relation to the other characters as well as their relevance to whatever the plot is becoming. As for the plot, it tries to be too mysterious and foreboding that it only confuses itself in numerous plot holes and bad character decisions for the sake of extending the story and providing unnecessary drama.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23011,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7}}</script><metacontent="

Mercury Rising: Directed by Harold Becker. With Bruce Willis, Alec Baldwin, Miko Hughes, Chi McBride. Miko Hughes was an extremely convincing actor does a good job.

programme.title: Mythica: The Godslayer
Mythica: Pogromca bogów
programme.desc:
Mythica: The Godslayer: Directed by John Lyde. With Melanie Stone, Adam Johnson, Matthew Mercer, Jake Stormoen. As the Lich King's zombie legions ravage the world, a cursed young sorceress and her friend Dagen, a self-serving half-elf rogue, embark on a quest to obtain a weapon from the gods." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5327922/","name":"Mythica: The Godslayer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VkMDI1N2QtNTljOC00N2U1LTgxZTctZTZjMzBlYzc2NmY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDUxNjc5NjY@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5752523/","name":"Melanie Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424453/","name":"Adam Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2233310/","name":"Matthew Mercer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1439346/","name":"John Lyde"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0337558/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0249378/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1131306/","name":"Jason Faller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1344786/","name":"Kynan Griffin"}],"datePublished":"2016-11-19","description":"As the Lich King's zombie legions ravage the world, a cursed young sorceress and her friend Dagen, a self-serving half-elf rogue, embark on a quest to obtain a weapon from the gods.","keywords":"sword and sorcery","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5327922/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fig-75275"},"dateCreated":"2017-06-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good, but not perfect","reviewBody":"Mythica: The Godslayer continues where Mythica: The Iron Crown left off. The first half of the film is brilliant and I was completely immersed in the story.

I felt it lost its way though when they were trying to retrieve the Hammer of Tek. I just wish that part had made more sense and Tek's character had been given more to say and do. The story begins to make sense again once we leave Tek and the Underworld behind. 

I didn't like the ending at first, it reminded me of another film with a similar ending, but I had another think about it and I realised that it was much smarter than I had first thought. Overall, Mythica: The Godslayer lived up to my expectations, 8/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

The first half of the film is brilliant and I was completely immersed in the story.

A secret military team, SG-1, is formed to explore other planets through the recently discovered Stargates." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0118480/","name":"Stargate SG-1","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3MjEwMTc5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQ2NjQ4NA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000760/","name":"Richard Dean Anderson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0788218/","name":"Michael Shanks","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0850102/","name":"Amanda Tapping"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129774/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005244/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0214390/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322106/","name":"Jonathan Glassner","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0942249/","name":"Brad Wright"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stargate SG-1: The Complete Tenth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi444989721","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzczMjM1M2MtNzFjZi00ZWYwLTlkNzAtOGQwN2E2MzdhMDg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzczMjM1M2MtNzFjZi00ZWYwLTlkNzAtOGQwN2E2MzdhMDg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","datePublished":"1997-07-27","description":"A secret military team, SG-1, is formed to explore other planets through the recently discovered Stargates.","keywords":"shared universe,military,message from outer space,alternate history,2000s","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118480/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"johndec","dateCreated":"2004-11-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well Done!","reviewBody":"The movie was groundbreaking, and its ideas had great potential for further development. Usually, sequels are made to continue the story on the big screen. Creating this excellent series was a much better decision than producing lousy sequels for the masses. 

Fans of the movie get to further explore all the ideas: The Stargate system, used by humans to travel the galaxy for thousands of years; Egyptian, Norse, and alien mythology; true science fiction - with fictional devices and concepts based on current science; and human exploration of our known universe  part of what made Star Trek so popular. 

You see the characters develop over time, the quirky unexpected humor, the use of an alien who doesn't fully understand American English (like Data), the struggle of the oppressed, the lengths humans go in order to survive, politics and government bureaucracy, and the underlying tenet that there is more to human life then our brief appearance on planet Earth.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85393,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4</script><metacontent="

Ma famille et le loup
Chłopiec i wilk
programme.desc:
Ma famille et le loup: Directed by Adrià García. With Carmen Maura, Pierre Rochefort, Bruno Salomone, Franc Bruneau. 9 years old Hugo spends the summer holidays with his cousins and his grandma Sara. When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5869404/","name":"Ma famille et le loup","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYwNmVlNTctM2MxYS00MWUyLTg0ZTYtYTg2NDIzMWU0YmNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA1MDczNjc@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0560962/","name":"Carmen Maura"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734004/","name":"Pierre Rochefort"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0758912/","name":"Bruno Salomone"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2348224/","name":"Adrià García"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0596308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0698042/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0384091/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5526293/","name":"Valérie Magis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1166131/","name":"Stéphane Malandrin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159646/","name":"Víctor Maldonado"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2453519385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZiZWJhZTAtNThjMS00NWRhLWEzNDMtNDFkYTJlNDdjZWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZiZWJhZTAtNThjMS00NWRhLWEzNDMtNDFkYTJlNDdjZWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2019-08-21","description":"9 years old Hugo spends the summer holidays with his cousins and his grandma Sara. When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure","keywords":"children","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5869404/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The wolf always wins.","reviewBody":"In the children's imaginative world there are the goodies (Santa Claus, the Tooth Fairy) and the baddies ( the Wolf ,the Bogey Man) .The Wolf wins in Charles Perrault' s "the Little Red riding Hood" ,even though the tale was often sweetened when told to children (the hunter's intervention).

Grandma met the Wolf when she was young (a little red riding hood ), but she was saved by the man who would become her husband (the equivalent of the hunter).But this summer ,he comes to take her back,now that she is about to celebrate her eightieth birthday.

Her grandchilden are not prepared to accept it ; instead of bickering ,they will spend their holidays looking for a way to prevent grandma from being "wolfed" .But the old lady had already told Hugo -it was the first time he had met her ,for his dad is a workaholic,often on his mobile - there was no sense in trying for she made a deal when she was young,and now her time has come.In the show they stage , granny appears in the finale -after some ponderous acts- just to say goodbye to all her family to urge them to carry on:we survive through our children and our life is eternal.

The movie adds computer animation for the imaginary scenes; the last ones ,in which the wolf intervenes with real characters,a la "Mary Poppins" , are the most successful.

By and large, nevertheless, acting and directing are not equal to the subject :with the exception of the deeply moving Carmen Maura , the actors overplay : the male cast ,particularly , tries to hog the stage and they are almost unbearable ;besides ,in the bakery , they got an incredible nerve ,not exactly an useful example for the young audience ;poetry which was present in Jean-Claude Brialy 's "Eglantine" (1971) on a similar subject is nowhere to be found.

That said, even though the results are not always satisfying , it was a good way to deal with a harsh subject :the ineluctable .The younger audience will certainly need explanations from their parents after viewing it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H20M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Alice et Martin
Alice i Martin
programme.desc: Alice et Martin: Directed by André Téchiné. With Juliette Binoche, Alexis Loret, Mathieu Amalric, Carmen Maura. A young man starts an affair with a woman - his brother's friend. Their relations are being tested because of obscure secrets hidden in the past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0176422/","name":"Alice et Martin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjNiMGNiMWUtNDE4Mi00NjkyLWIwNjItNTdkNmRlNjhiM2NmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjYyNzc4MQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520870/","name":"Alexis Loret"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0023832/","name":"Mathieu Amalric"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022244/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016296/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000801/","name":"Olivier Assayas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851522/","name":"Gilles Taurand"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Alice and Martin","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2192900377","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWMwZmVlYjQtMjhlYi00Y2Q5LWE3MzAtZGMyZTA5ZjE5ZjM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWMwZmVlYjQtMjhlYi00Y2Q5LWE3MzAtZGMyZTA5ZjE5ZjM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from PolyGram Video"},"datePublished":"1998-11-04","description":"A young man starts an affair with a woman - his brother's friend. Their relations are being tested because of obscure secrets hidden in the past.","keywords":"character names as title,forenames as title,three word title,gay,paris france","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0176422/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hsma"},"dateCreated":"2000-08-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too disjointed","reviewBody":"Although the performances were good, this movie is quite frustrating. While a non-linear narrative can be effective and compelling, the disjointed plot or lack of one leaves the viewer bored and confused. The story line is further strained by the lack of development of much of Alice's and Martin's characters. For instance, one can't understand why Martin's father was such a brute or why Alice would choose to stay with Martin. It's a shame because this movie could have been a lot better.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1677,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Czempion
programme.desc: Marian (Marek Siudym), starzejący się mistrz kolarstwa, pracuje jako stróż na złomowisku samochodów. Przytłacza go samotne życie na odludziu. Ulega pokusie i podejmuje próbę zmiany swojej sytuacji. Okazuje się jednak, że nie jest to łatwe w nieznanym mu wirtualnym świecie, rzeczywistości selfie czy miłości na sprzedaż.

credits.actor: Marek Siudym
Michał Piela
Maria Patykiewicz

programme.title: Wiki
programme.desc: Autystyczna Wiki (Kamila Kobic) jest ciekawa świata. Musi zmierzyć się z trudną rzeczywistością. Pewnego dnia spotyka Mateusza (Adam Bobik), fana autobusów warszawskiej komunikacji miejskiej, który wprowadza radość do jej szarego życia.

credits.actor: Kamila Kobic

programme.title: Spitsbergen
programme.desc: Magda (Magdalena Czerwińska), zawieszona ratowniczka medyczna, otrzymuje nagłe wezwanie. Oznacza to dla niej powrót do dramatycznych wydarzeń i ludzkich tragedii. Gdy opada poziom adrenaliny, kobieta przypomina sobie podróże na Spitsbergen - mroźną norweską wyspę na Morzu Arktycznym. To miejsce stało się dla niej powodem traumy, z którą do tej pory nie zdołała się uporać. Przerastają ją cudze nieszczęścia i własna przeszłość.

credits.actor: Magdalena Czerwińska
Marek Kossakowski
Marian Dziędziel

programme.title: Tata
programme.desc: Członkowie dwupokoleniowej rodziny próbują żyć ze świadomością o jej rozpadzie. Niektórzy starają się to akceptować i trwać w takiej rzeczywistości, a inni chcą się z niej wydostać. Liczne problemy, rozpadające się związki i rozwody negatywnie wpływają na stosunki międzyludzkie. Wszystko to odbija się na dzieciach, które w ten sposób tracą szansę na normalny rozwój. Przedstawiana historia widziana jest z perspektywy małego dziecka, obserwującego zachowania swoich rodziców. Rozgrywający się dramat ojca Janusza (Grzegorz Juchiewicz) uwidacznia bezsilność w bezwiednie zapoczątkowanej autodestrukcji.

programme.title: The Bedroom Window
Widok z sypialni
programme.desc:
The Bedroom Window: Directed by Curtis Hanson. With Steve Guttenberg, Elizabeth McGovern, Isabelle Huppert, Paul Shenar. A young executive starts an affair with his boss's wife which then escalates into a nightmare after he lies to the police in order to protect her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0092627/","name":"The Bedroom Window","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQ4OWUxN2UtNTVhMy00Y2E3LTk0NTYtMjRiNzZjYjc1OTUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Mystery","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000430/","name":"Steve Guttenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001527/","name":"Elizabeth McGovern"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000436/","name":"Curtis Hanson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046277/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0390159/","name":"Anne Holden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000436/","name":"Curtis Hanson"}],"datePublished":"1987-01-16","description":"A young executive starts an affair with his boss's wife which then escalates into a nightmare after he lies to the police in order to protect her.","keywords":"rape,neo noir,revenge,rape victim,hitchcockian","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0092627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Doylenf"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Neat Hitchcock-type thriller with unconvincing twists...","reviewBody":"This is the kind of thriller you'd expect Alfred Hitchcock to do with someone like James Stewart or Cary Grant as everyman.

Here we have STEVE GUTTENBERG as the man in big trouble after witnessing a murder from his lover's bedroom window. He's having an affair with the boss' wife and nobly tells her that he'll give details of the assailant (which she saw) to keep their affair hidden from her husband. So far, so good. The story is stylishly photographed with the appropriate menacing mood and atmosphere.

But he soon becomes the man suspected of the crime and it's from that point on that the plot contrivances become just a little too implausible, straining credibility until the very suspenseful ending. Too bad. Otherwise, it's a tricky piece of entertainment and well worth watching.

ISABELLE HUPPERT has a little trouble getting her lines across with her French accent being quite a handicap but she's beautiful to look at. ELIZABETH McGOVERN does a nice job as Guttenberg's partner in finding the real killer.

It moves quickly under writer/director CURTIS HANSON's direction. While many consider it "counterfeit Hitchcock", it's still worth a look.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4962,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

Here we have STEVE GUTTENBERG as the man in big trouble after witnessing a murder from his lover's bedroom window. He's having an affair with the boss' wife and nobly tells her that he'll give details of the assailant (which she saw) to keep their affair hidden from her husband. So far, so good. The story is stylishly photographed with the appropriate menacing mood and atmosphere.

But he soon becomes the man suspected of the crime and it's from that point on that the plot contrivances become just a little too implausible, straining credibility until the very suspenseful ending. Too bad. Otherwise, it's a tricky piece of entertainment and well worth watching.

ISABELLE HUPPERT has a little trouble getting her lines across with her French accent being quite a handicap but she's beautiful to look at. ELIZABETH McGOVERN does a nice job as Guttenberg's partner in finding the real killer.

It moves quickly under writer/director CURTIS HANSON's direction. programme.title: Psychobitch
Psycholka
programme.desc:
Psychobitch: Directed by Martin Lund. With Jonas Tidemann, Elli Rhiannon Müller Osborne, Saara Sipila-Kristoffersen, Bethina Nærby. Frida is different. Marius, on the other hand is the most perfect boy in class. When they have to work together at school, it's the start of a turbulent and challenging relationship. Generation Achievement meets impossible love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8360266/","name":"Psychobitch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdiYzc2ZjctOWNiNS00OWQ2LWE4ZjktNmY4YjVmZGE5N2RhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6638989/","name":"Jonas Tidemann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9602953/","name":"Elli Rhiannon Müller Osborne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9811535/","name":"Saara Sipila-Kristoffersen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1814880/","name":"Martin Lund"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0291647/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0780832/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054056/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1814880/","name":"Martin Lund"}],"datePublished":"2019-01-11","description":"Frida is different. Marius, on the other hand is the most perfect boy in class. When they have to work together at school, it's the start of a turbulent and challenging relationship. Generation Achievement meets impossible love.","keywords":"eastern europe,boy,one word title,teenage boy,teenage girl","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8360266/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"beormas"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unusual teen romance","reviewBody":"Marius is a good boy. He's good in school, he always does what he's told and what's expected of him. We as the audience are never exactly told if he's happy with that, but we suspect that he's not. In comes Frida, the new girl in school who, rumour has it, had tried to commit suicide. She's the exact opposite, she never does what she's told and shows some very rude behaviour. For a class project, a techer asks Marius to team up with Frida and although he's not thrilled, he can't say no., so he awkwardly tries to engage with Frida. Being strong-willed, Frida plays with Marius and makes him do things that are completely against his nature, even things that are forbidden. Not to spoil anything, you can guess that a teen romance eventlually leads to them falling in love, not without complications like the girl Marius used to date before he met Frida.

IMDb data; ttnr: 8360266, Title: Psychobitch, --- Description: Psychobitch: Directed by Martin Lund. With Jonas Tidemann, Elli Rhiannon Müller Osborne, Saara Sipila-Kristoffersen, Bethina Nærby.
